scenario_text.value: Oh, Takuma! You came back too.

Yeah, I thought the others might’ve finished
searching by now, so I stopped by.

Miu and Renamon told me what it’s like out
there. Sounds like it’s worse than we feared.

Yeah, it’s bad. The fog’s settling in
everywhere.

About the only places that are still safe are
this school and the shrine.

The area around the inner shrine seems normal
too. I checked on my way back.

I see. I must say, I never expected the fog
would have spread so far.

I hope Aoi and Labramon are still safe out
there...

You...you don’t think they’ve already been
swallowed by the fog, do you?

(Miu seems really upset. I need to find some
way to calm her down.)

(But no amount of me saying I’m sure they’re
okay is going to be very convincing.)

(Maybe she’ll be more likely to believe that
coming from an adult like the professor.)

(Or then again, maybe asking Shakomon to
reassure her would be more effective.)

(Maybe if Renamon were to comfort her, that
could be really convincing.)
(Who might best cheer up Miu?)
Maybe the professor...
I’d say Shakomon.
Renamon?
The professor

(Since he’s an adult, I think it’d be best to
have the professor say something.)

Uh, Professor, do you think maybe you could
say something to reassure Miu?
She seems like she’s really upset.
Hm? Oh, yes, of course. I’ll give it a try.
Miu, might I speak with you?
Okay...

Believe me, I can understand your distress,
but you must try not to be dismayed.

Being troubled by outcomes you cannot verify
brings no solutions, only frustration.
Uh... Huh? Sorry, what are you trying to say?

Hm... Perhaps I should have stated things
more simply.

In other words... It’s important to proceed
with the belief that things will work out.
Shakomon

(Shakomon knows Miu better than anyone and
is probably the best choice to comfort her.)

Uh, Shakomon, do you think you can say
something to Miu to help her feel better?

Oh, I had every intention of doing so. Leave
this to me!
Don’t worry, Miu. I’m sure they’re both fine.
Can you prove that?
Well...no, not exactly, but...

So you don’t know! You shouldn’t just make
stuff up like that!
But Miu, have I ever lied to you?
Well...no, I don’t think so.

You see? You can trust me. I just know that
Aoi and Labramon are safe out there.
Yeah, okay...

(Nice going, Shakomon! Relying on the bond of
trust you’ve built between you.)
Renamon

(I’m sure Renamon will be able to sound
convincing. I’ll ask him.)

Uh, Renamon, do you think you can say
something to Miu to help put her at ease?

I’m not sure if she’ll find what I say very
reassuring, but I’ll try.
Miu...
Hm? What is it, Renamon?

Do you think Aoi and Labramon would simply
vanish into the fog?
Of course not!

Then that’s all you need to know. If you
believe they’re safe, then that’s that.
Oh yeah!

You’re right... That’s all there is to it.
Yeah. I believe in them!

But with all that fog, we won’t be able to
look around very well.
How are we going to find Aoi and Labramon?
Actually, I think you’ve got it backwards.
Backwards?

Ah, I see what you mean. If there are only
a few places left without any fog...

Then Aoi and Labramon can only be in one of
those places!

Exactly. They’re probably somewhere near the
school, the shrine, or the inner shrine.
So, should we go looking for them right away?

No, it could be dangerous for us to get any
more split up.

First we should get everyone back together,
then we can all go looking for Aoi.
Yes, that seems best.

Agumon and I will track down Kaito and Minoru
and tell them to head back to the school.
Meanwhile, you all wait here.
We’ll be counting on you, Takuma!

After everyone gets back, we’ll go find Aoi
for sure this time!

We’ll wait here. You go find the others as
soon as you can!
